meanings.sent1: She pressurises the bottle to open it.
meanings.sent2: He pressurises the brakes to slow down the car.
meanings.sent3: The chef pressurises the dough to make it rise.
meanings.sent4: The coach pressurises the team to perform their best.
meanings.sent5: The doctor pressurises the wound to stop the bleeding.

meanings.definition: To subject to pressure or stress (verb)
meanings.sent1: The tight deadline pressurises the employees to finish the project.
meanings.sent2: Financial difficulties can pressurise a family.
meanings.sent3: The noisy neighbors pressurise the peaceful atmosphere of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The upcoming exam pressurises the students to study harder.
meanings.sent5: The constant criticism pressurises her self-esteem.
